text: Albert Bouvet (28 February 1930 – 20 May 2017) was a French professional cyclist. He won Paris–Tours in 1956 and remained the last Frenchman to win until Jacky Durand won in 1998. His name is also associated with Paris–Roubaix, as an organiser and discoverer of new sections of pavé.Albert Bouvet . cyclingarchives.com He was born in Mellé, Ille-et-Vilaine. Bouvet died on 20 May 2017 in Paris at the age of 87. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1930 births Category:2017 deaths Category:French cyclists Category:People from Ille-et-Vilaine Category:Sportspeople from Brittany
title: Albert Bouvet
